Solving the Battleship interview question

Last weekâ€™s episode about technical interview was a hit, so we asked Kevin to come back and show us how to solve a common hypothetical interview question. He suggested one of his favorites: programming the classic board game Battleship.

There are three parts to the solution: rules & assumptions, setup (placing ships on the board), and missile firing (calculating hits). Got questions? Post them on YouTube!

What are stock options?

An important part of evaluating a startup job offer is understanding your stock options. This week on the Commit, our CEO Brandon Kessler has some great tips thatâ€™ll get you past the jargon and the hype.

Things weâ€™ll discuss: stock options, grants, vesting periods, strike price, exercising your options, liquidity events, IPOs, and acquisitions.

Making mobile games at Small Planet

Ever wonder what game developers do all day? Or if making games is different than making apps? This week on The Commit, we asked Taylor Plimpton, a Senior Developer at Small Planet (a digital agency in Brooklyn, NY), to share the ins and out of game development, tools & tech, dev process, what kind of input developers have on the final product, and more!

Inside Justworks

This week, we went to Justworks to see how engineers and benefits specialists are working together to streamline Human Resources for small and mid-size business across America.

We learned about self-directed teams, culture, remote work (and robots!), the tech stack (Ruby on Rails, AWS, MySQL, Redshift, React), and more.

Want to join the team? Check out Justworksâ€™ team page: http://devpost.com/teams/justworks
